details:
A vulnerability was found in the Mercurial version control system
which could lead to remote arbitrary code execution.


* [CVE-2017-17458](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-17458)
A specially malformed Mercurial repository could cause Git
 subrepositories to run arbitrary code in the form of a
 .git/hooks/post-update script checked into the parent repository.
 Typical use of Mercurial prevents construction of such repositories,
 but they can be created programmatically.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
2.2.2-4+deb7u6.


We recommend that you upgrade your mercurial packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
